info.title: Sports World Central (SWC) Fantasy Football API
info.description:
This API provides read-only access to info from the Sports World Central (SWC) Fantasy Football API. 
The endpoints are grouped into the following categories:

## Analytics
Get information about health of the API and counts of leagues, teams, and players.

## Player
You can get a list of an NFL players, or search for an individual player by player_id.

## Scoring
You can get a list of NFL player performances, including the fantasy points they scored using SWC league scoring.

## Membership
Get information about all the SWC fantasy football leagues and the teams in them.

get.summary: Check to see if the SWC fantasy football API is running
get.description: Use this endpoint to check if the API is running. You can also check it first before making other calls to be sure it's running.

200.description: A JSON record with a message in it. If the API is running the message will say successful.

get.summary: Get all the SWC players that meet all the parameters you sent with your request
get.description: Use this endpoint to get a list of SWC players. You can use the parameters to filter down the players in the list. Names are not unique. You use the skip and limit to perform pagination of the API. Don't use the Player ID values to perform counts. Those are not guaranteed to be in order.

parameters.name: skip

schema.description: The number of items to skip at the beginning of API call.
schema.title: Skip

parameters.description: The number of items to skip at the beginning of API call.

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: The number of records to return after the skipped records.
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: The number of records to return after the skipped records.

parameters.name: minimum_last_changed_date

schema.description: The minimum data of change that you want to return records. Exclude any records changed before this.
schema.title: Minimum Last Changed Date

parameters.description: The minimum data of change that you want to return records. Exclude any records changed before this.

parameters.name: first_name

schema.description: The first name of the players to return
schema.title: First Name

parameters.description: The first name of the players to return

parameters.name: last_name

schema.description: The last name of the players to return
schema.title: Last Name

parameters.description: The last name of the players to return

200.description: A list of NFL players that are in SWC fantasy football. They don't to be on a team.

get.summary: Get one player using the Player ID, which is internal to SWC
get.description: If you have an SWC Player ID of a player from another API call such as v0_get_players, you can call this API using the player ID

get.summary: Get all the weekly performances that meet all the parameters you sent with your request
get.description: Use this endpoint to get lists of weekly performances by players in the SWC. You us the skip and limit to perform pagination of the API. Don't use the Performance ID for counting or logic, because that is an internal ID and is not guaranteed to be sequential

parameters.name: skip

schema.description: The number of items to skip at the beginning of API call.
schema.title: Skip

parameters.description: The number of items to skip at the beginning of API call.

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: The number of records to return after the skipped records.
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: The number of records to return after the skipped records.

parameters.name: minimum_last_changed_date

schema.description: The minimum data of change that you want to return records. Exclude any records changed before this.
schema.title: Minimum Last Changed Date

parameters.description: The minimum data of change that you want to return records. Exclude any records changed before this.

200.description: A list of weekly scoring performances. It may be by multiple players.

get.summary: Get one league by league id
get.description: Use this endpoint to get a single league that matches the league ID provided by the user.

get.summary: Get all the SWC fantasy football leagues that match the parameters you send
get.description: Use this endpoint to get lists of SWC fantasy football leagues. You us the skip and limit to perform pagination of the API. League name is not guaranteed to be unique. Don't use the League ID for counting or logic, because that is an internal ID and is not guaranteed to be sequential

parameters.name: skip

schema.description: The number of items to skip at the beginning of API call.
schema.title: Skip

parameters.description: The number of items to skip at the beginning of API call.

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: The number of records to return after the skipped records.
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: The number of records to return after the skipped records.

parameters.name: minimum_last_changed_date

schema.description: The minimum data of change that you want to return records. Exclude any records changed before this.
schema.title: Minimum Last Changed Date

parameters.description: The minimum data of change that you want to return records. Exclude any records changed before this.

parameters.name: league_name

schema.description: Name of the leagues to return. Not unique in the SWC.
schema.title: League Name

parameters.description: Name of the leagues to return. Not unique in the SWC.

200.description: A list of leagues on the SWC fantasy football website.

get.summary: Get all the SWC fantasy football teams that match the parameters you send
get.description: Use this endpoint to get lists of SWC fantasy football teams. You us the skip and limit to perform pagination of the API. Team name is not guaranteed to be unique. If you get the Team ID from another query such as v0_get_players, you can match it with the Team ID from this query.  Don't use the Team ID for counting or logic, because that is an internal ID and is not guaranteed to be sequential

parameters.name: skip

schema.description: The number of items to skip at the beginning of API call.
schema.title: Skip

parameters.description: The number of items to skip at the beginning of API call.

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: The number of records to return after the skipped records.
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: The number of records to return after the skipped records.

parameters.name: minimum_last_changed_date

schema.description: The minimum data of change that you want to return records. Exclude any records changed before this.
schema.title: Minimum Last Changed Date

parameters.description: The minimum data of change that you want to return records. Exclude any records changed before this.

parameters.name: team_name

schema.description: Name of the teams to return. Not unique across SWC, but is unique inside a league.
schema.title: Team Name

parameters.description: Name of the teams to return. Not unique across SWC, but is unique inside a league.

parameters.name: league_id

schema.description: League ID of the teams to return. Unique in SWC.
schema.title: League Id

parameters.description: League ID of the teams to return. Unique in SWC.

200.description: A list of teams on the SWC fantasy football website.

get.summary: Get counts of the number of leagues, teams, and players in the SWC fantasy football
get.description: Use this endpoint to count the number of leagues, teams, and players in the SWC fantasy football. Use in combination with skip and limit in v0_get leagues, v0_get_teams, or v0_get_players. Use this endpoint to get counts instead of making calls to the other APIs.

200.description: A list of teams on the SWC fantasy football website.
